body_html:
@drpngx

@rongjiecomputer did you address @sanjoy comments?

Only partially. @sanjoy left these two comments.

  1. Avoid #define TF_XLA_HAS_SSE4_1 1 and just have #define TF_XLA_HAS_SSE4_1: I have done this part.

  2. Putting all of these definitions (TF_XLA_HAS_*) in a single header: I gave the explanation why I did not follow this comment.

I have eventually decided to not splitting the definitions out into a new header file. That requires adding a new cc_library and make three cc_library(name = "cpu_runtime_*") to depend on it due to Bazel's strict header dependency. Seems over-complicated.
body:
@drpngx 

> @rongjiecomputer did you address @sanjoy comments?

Only partially. @sanjoy left these two comments.

1. Avoid `#define TF_XLA_HAS_SSE4_1 1` and just have `#define TF_XLA_HAS_SSE4_1`: I have done this part.

2. Putting all of these definitions (`TF_XLA_HAS_*`) in a single header: I gave the explanation why I did not follow this comment.

> I have eventually decided to not splitting the definitions out into a new header file. That requires adding a new cc_library and make three cc_library(name = "cpu_runtime_*") to depend on it due to Bazel's strict header dependency. Seems over-complicated.
